Kemendagri Catat Ada 4 Desa 'Hantu', Semuanya di Sulawesi Tenggara
05 Nov 2019, 08:46 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Matius Alfons-detikcom

Jakarta - Kementerian Dalam Negeri (Kemendagri) mengungkapkan bahwa fenomena desa 'hantu' alias tak berpenghuni berada di salah satu Kabupaten, Provinsi Sulawesi Tenggara. Desa tersebut sengah dibentuk demi mendapatkan aliran uang program dana desa.Dirjen Bina Pemerintahan Desa Kemendagri, Nata Irawan mengatakan bahwa pembentukan desa fiktif ini sudah lama terjadi dan telah terendus oleh Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK)."Itu isu sudah lama, tapi dikembangkan lagi, sudah pernah didiskusikan oleh KPK, di salah satu desa di Sulawesi salah satu Kabupaten ada desa fiktif," kata Nata saat dihubungi detikcom, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Nata mengungkapkan ada empat desa 'hantu' alias fiktif yang selama ini sudah menerima aliran dana desa. Pihaknya pun telah menurunkan tim untuk melakukan pemeriksaan."Ditjen Bina Pemerintahan Desa membentuk tim, tim kami turun melihat langsung benar ada atau tidak isu itu, ternyata memang ada 4 desa yang tidak memenuhi syarat terbentuk menjadi sebuah desa," tegas Nata.Sebelumnya, Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengungkapkan bahwa saat ini banyak muncul desa 'hantu' atau desa-desa baru yang tidak berpenghuni. Desa tersebut muncul tiba-tiba demi mendapatkan alokasi anggaran program dana desa yang sudah dijalankan Pemerintah.Hal itu diungkapkannya saat melaporkan evaluasi kinerja APBN Tahun Anggaran 2019 di ruang rapat Komisi XI dewan Perwakilan Rakyat (DPR), Jakarta Selatan."Sekarang muncul desa-desa baru yang nggak ada penduduknya karena adanya dana desa," kata Sri Mulyani, Senin (4/11/2019).Kementerian Keuangan mengalokasikan anggaran dana desa sebesar Rp 70 triliun di tahun 2019. Indonesia memiliki 74.597 desa di 2019, di mana setiap desa mendapatkan anggaran sekitar Rp 900 juta.

Ministry of Home Affairs Note There are 4 'Ghost' Villages, all in Southeast Sulawesi
05 Nov 2019, 08:46 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Matthew Alfons-detikcom

Jakarta - The Ministry of Home Affairs (Kemendagri) revealed that the phenomenon of 'ghost' or uninhabited villages resides in one of the regencies, Southeast Sulawesi Province. The village was half formed to get the money flow of the village fund program. Director General of Village Ministry of Home Affairs Development, Nata Irawan said that the formation of this fictitious village had been a long time ago and had been detected by the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK). The KPK has already discussed it, in one village in Sulawesi, one of the regencies there is a fictitious village, "Nata said when contacted by AFP, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). Nata revealed there were four 'ghost' villages, aka fictitious ones. has received a stream of village funds. "The Directorate General of Village Government Development formed a team, our team went down to see whether there was a real issue or not, apparently there were 4 villages that did not meet the requirements to form a village," said Nata. Previously, the Minister Finance of Sri Mulyani Indrawati revealed that currently there are many 'ghost' villages or new uninhabited villages. The village appeared suddenly in order to get the budget allocation of the village fund program that has been run by the Government. It was revealed when reporting the evaluation of the 2019 Budget Year State Budget performance in the Commission XI meeting room of the House of Representatives (DPR), South Jakarta. there are no new residents due to village funds, "Sri Mulyani said, Monday (11/04/2019). The Ministry of Finance allocated a village budget of Rp 70 trillion in 2019. Indonesia has 74,597 villages in 2019, where each village receives budget of around Rp 900 million.
